abstract: Apple and AT&T defended a decision not to use a faster but more limited network for the phone’s wireless Internet connection.
snippet: Apple and AT&T defended a decision not to use a faster but more limited network for the phone’s wireless Internet connection.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, June 28 — On the eve of the Apple iPhone’s sale, the top executives of Apple and AT&T defended their decision to rely upon AT&T’s slow Edge wireless data network, rather than a faster network that is less widely available.

headline.main: Chiefs Defend Slow Network for the iPhone
headline.print_headline: Chiefs Defend Slow Network For the iPhone

abstract: Apple and AT&T defended a decision not to use a faster but more limited network for the phone’s wireless Internet connection.
snippet: Apple and AT&T defended a decision not to use a faster but more limited network for the phone’s wireless Internet connection.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, June 28 — On the eve of the Apple iPhone’s debut, the top executives of Apple and AT&T today defended their decision to rely upon AT&T’s slow Edge wireless data network, rather than a faster network that is less widely available.

headline.main: A Trade-Off on iPhone Data Speed

abstract: EMI Music and Snocap will announce that Snocap will sell the label’s music in its MyStores, online shops that can be added to various sites on the Internet.
snippet: EMI Music and Snocap will announce that Snocap will sell the label’s music in its MyStores, online shops that can be added to various sites on the Internet.
lead_paragraph: Music blogs and social networking sites like MySpace are playing an increasingly important part in record companies’ marketing plans. Now they will also be able to sell songs from a major label that will play on the iPod from Apple.

headline.main: On the Web, EMI to Offer More Choices
headline.print_headline: On the Web, EMI to Offer More Choices

abstract: Customers eager to buy the cellphone had waited in long lines in front of Apple stores in New York and other cities.
snippet: Customers eager to buy the cellphone had waited in long lines in front of Apple stores in New York and other cities.
lead_paragraph: Apple wanted a spectacle when the iPhone went on sale this evening, and it got just that.

abstract: Customers eager to buy the cellphone had waited in long lines in front of Apple stores in New York and other cities.
snippet: Customers eager to buy the cellphone had waited in long lines in front of Apple stores in New York and other cities.
lead_paragraph: Customers eager to buy the cellphone had waited in long lines in front of Apple stores in New York and other cities.

abstract: Wowed by the iPhone? Then buy Google, not Apple, argues a Wall Street analyst.
snippet: Wowed by the iPhone? Then buy Google, not Apple, argues a Wall Street analyst.
lead_paragraph: So you read the rave reviews the iPhone is getting, and you notice that there are lines outside Apple stores to buy it. Maybe you wonder if you should buy Apple’s stock to cash in on the frenzy.

abstract: By noon today outside the Apple Store at a pleasant outdoor mall in Corte Madera, 20 minutes north of San Francisco, a touch of line rage had already set in. When five big young guys sauntered up to the line where 90 of us had already been standing — some since 6 a.m. yesterday morning — they settled down into camping chairs directly in front of me that had been set up for them earlier by a friend who happened to be an Apple employee.
lead_paragraph: By noon today outside the Apple Store at a pleasant outdoor mall in Corte Madera, 20 minutes north of San Francisco, a touch of line rage had already set in. When five big young guys sauntered up to the line where 90 of us had already been standing — some since 6 a.m. yesterday morning — they settled down into camping chairs directly in front of me that had been set up for them earlier by a friend who happened to be an Apple employee.

headline.main: So What’s a Little Line Rage Between iPhone Maniacs?
